Article.Abstract: Puumala hantavirus (PUUV) is a rodent-borne agent causing nephropathia epidemica in humans, a milder form of haemorrhagic fever with renal syndrome occurring in Fennoscandia, central Europe and western Russia. In this study we characterized the immunogenicity of an E. coli-expressed nucleocapsid (N) protein of PUUV (strain Kazan-E6) in inbred mice (BALB/c, CBA and C57/BL6). The recombinant N (rN) protein raised PUUV-specific antibodies in all three tested murine haplotypes, and all IgG subclasses were detected. Epitope mapping using peptides spanning the N protein revealed that the B-cell recognition sites were mainly located at the amino-terminal part of the protein. Proliferative T-helper (Th) lymphocyte responses were detected in all haplotypes after a single immunization with rN. Several Th-recognition sites, spanning amino acids 6-27, 96-117, 211-232 and 256-277, were identified using overlapping peptides. Peptides representing the identified sites could also prime Th-lymphocytes to proliferate in response to recall with rN protein, thereby confirming the authenticity of the identified sites. The rN-primed Th-lymphocytes produced predominantly interleukin (IL)-2 and gamma interferon, together with lower levels of IL-4 and IL-6, indicating a mixed Th1/Th2 response.
Article.ArticleTitle: T-helper and humoral responses to Puumala hantavirus nucleocapsid protein: identification of T-helper epitopes in a mouse model.
Article.Affiliations: Microbiology and Tumor Biology Center, Karolinska Institutet, S-171 77 Stockholm, Sweden1; Division of Clinical Virology, F68, Oral Microbiology, F88, and Basic Oral Sciences, F59, Huddinge University Hospital, S-141 86 Huddinge, Sweden2; Swedish Institute for Infectious Disease Control, S-171 82 Stockholm, Sweden3.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: One dose of 100ug.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were immunized with 100ug of recombinant N protein emulsified in Freund's complete adjuvant.

MhcAllele.MhcEvidenceCode: T cell assay -Single MHC type present

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lymphocytes from mice immunized with the epitope proliferated in response to the epitope.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: Two doses of 20ug and then 50ug, administered at intervals of 4 weeks.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Mice were immunized with 20 ug of recombinant N protein emulsified in Freund's complete adjuvant. The mice were boosted 4 weeks later subcutaneously with 50 ug of rN protein emulsified in Freund's incomplete adjuvant and sera were collected by retroorbital bleedings at 2, 4 and 6 weeks.

MhcAllele.MhcEvidenceCode: T cell assay -Single MHC type present

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Lymphocytes from rN protein-primed H-2d mice were restimulated with 84 overlapping 17-mer peptides spanning the whole PUUV N protein. Four different antigenic regions within four pairs of overlapping peptides were detected. This epitope represents one of those regions. A separate assay characterizing cytokine production showed a mixture of Th1/Th2-like PUUV N protein-specific T lymphocytes were primed by immunization with rN protein.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Sera from rN protein-primed H-2d mice were restimulated with 86 overlapping 10-mer peptides spanning the whole PUUV N protein. The highest reactivity was seen against residues within the first 120 amino acids, showing that the major antigenic region of the protein is located within the N-terminus. Reactivity was similar in CBA and C57BL/6 mice.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Sera from rN protein-primed H-2d mice were restimulated with 86 overlapping 10-mer peptides spanning the whole PUUV N protein. The highest reactivity was seen against residues within the first 120 amino acids, showing that the major antigenic region of the protein is located within the N-terminus. Reactivity was similar in CBA and C57BL/6 mice.

The mice were boosted 4 weeks later subcutaneously with 50 ug of rN protein emulsified in Freund's incomplete adjuvant and sera were collected by retroorbital bleedings at 2, 4 and 6 weeks.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Sera from rN protein-primed H-2d mice were restimulated with 86 overlapping 10-mer peptides spanning the whole PUUV N protein. The highest reactivity was seen against residues within the first 120 amino acids, showing that the major antigenic region of the protein is located within the N-terminus. Reactivity was similar in CBA and C57BL/6 mice.

The mice were boosted 4 weeks later subcutaneously with 50 ug of rN protein emulsified in Freund's incomplete adjuvant and sera were collected by retroorbital bleedings at 2, 4 and 6 weeks.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Sera from rN protein-primed H-2d mice were restimulated with 86 overlapping 10-mer peptides spanning the whole PUUV N protein. The highest reactivity was seen against residues within the first 120 amino acids, showing that the major antigenic region of the protein is located within the N-terminus. Reactivity was similar in CBA and C57BL/6 mice.
